item.title: Capitalism D18EA397
item.description:
Most “free speech absolutists” are also “free market capitalists”

item.title: Facebook2 45E80C97
item.description: But then I finally broke free. I deleted facebook in 2013 and never looked back. My life and mental health have been 10x better since then. Feeling really good about that decision lately.

item.title: Facebook 260CFAF0
item.description:
On July 26, 2010 I wrote a blog post that said:

“I fucking hate facebook, but I don‚Äôt have the balls to delete it because then I would truly feel alone.”

https://levlaz.org/facebook/

item.title: Bookburning 0D43F0D6
item.description:
Re: check out my story on Instagram

Thank you so much for the invite, but I’ll not be attending this seasons book burnings. Give Julia my best.

item.title: Wp BFD4127B
item.description: I think Matt Mullenweg is having a midlife crisis. It’s such a shame to see him destory his lifes work with a few blog posts, slack messages and tweets. I don’t think there is any turning back.

item.title: Ai Meetup 60C3D345
item.description: Went to an AI Dev Tools meet up at the Cloudflare office last night hosted by Sourcegraph. It was awesome. Great people, cool demos, lots of buzz. Felt like #sanfrancisco of 2015.

item.title: Fedora D472ab7b
item.description: When did #Fedora get so good? I am really impresssed :D

item.title: Kill Bill CAE0839E
item.description: Watched Kill Bill v1 yesteday again. It’s one of my favorite movies and even after watching it so many times I am still mesmerized by the cinematic story telling. Its just brilliant.

item.description: Huge thank you to @tzeejay@mastodon.social for helping me fix some css bugs on my site. <3

item.title: Anki 691B5590
item.description:
I spent a few hours trying to get my Anki Flashcards to work on the Peleton screen. Sideloading took 5 minutes and felt magical. Trying to get any chinese font to load took 115 minutes and I gave up past midnight. :(

I am so close!

item.title: Hsk2 Edb9f099
item.description: Just learned that I passed my HSK Level 2 (chinese proficiency test)! Feeling really motivated :D

OOBE\BYPASSNRO

item.title: Charity
item.description:
Enjoying reading Charity Majors’ take on founder mode.

https://charity.wtf/2024/12/17/founder-mode-and-the-art-of-mythmaking/

But I’ll admit I just saw the graphic around Brooks’ Law for the first time in this post and it also blew my mind.

item.title: Windows
item.description:
When I was a kid I often ran Linux inside of a VM on Windows because I could not get networking to work properly.

These days, Window feels so enshittified that I can only tolerate running it inside of a VM.

Funny how things turned out. :)

item.title: Doctorow
item.description:
Cory Doctorow writes about the essential desire of artists to create in his end of year post. Inspiring stuff.

https://pluralistic.net/2024/12/21/blockheads-r-us/

item.title: Tweets C20392E9
item.description: Torn because people should be able to post whatever makes them happy, but I really wish folks would stop posting screenshots of melon husk’s tweets all over mastodon and bluesky. There’s a reason we’re here and not there.

item.title: Ghostty ECB509A2
item.description:
Ghostty is finally out :) https://ghostty.org/

I was just reading the post saying it was coming in December, Happy to note that I learned of the release on Mastodon! https://hachyderm.io/@mitchellh/113720986101323746

item.title: Matrix 35430763
item.description: Rewatched all of Matrix, its so good, especially thought provokin in a post LLM world.

item.title: Poweroff 47881332
item.description: Turned off my power for a few weeks to save a tiny bit of money while out of town and already regretting it because I run a few services on my NUC at home which breaks this blogs publishing workflow. :)

item.title: Remarkable 23FC9712
item.description: Remarkable is getting even more Remarkable. The desktop app now allows you to take notes by typing, then you can sync back to your tablet and write on it. Its really nice!

item.description: This weekend @sourishkrout.com and I submitted a CFP to #KubeCon London. This is my first one, I’m excited about the topic, wish us luck!

item.title: Bike B1C4B7B1
item.description: Rode my bicycle all the way to the end of the great highway and back today, it was really nice. I got the most satisfying deep breath of ocean air, made the whole trip worth it.

item.description: Cafe Suspiro at 9th & Folsom is my favorite Coffee Shop in #sanfrancisco. Such a great vibe, good coffee, vinyl, local books, its my happy place. :)

item.title: Lex 2eac59e8
item.description: Listening to Lex Fridman interview Argentinia’s president Javier Milei is shocking because he does not challenge a single thing that he says. Maybe its the translation system, but this is becoming a pattern for me. It’s so odd that the expert level interview skills that he’s developed over the years immediately melt away when he is talking to right wingers.

item.title: Winget Bf250535
item.description: winget makes windows so much more usable.

item.title: Noblog 58161395
item.description: If you’re a #startup, its better to have no blog than have one that does not get updated for months or years at a time. Customers, investors, and fans will assume you’ve died.

item.description:
word of the day - sycophant

noun

A person who attempts to gain advantage by flattering influential people or behaving in a servile manner.

item.title: Li 80194AE3
item.description: Caught myself twice today writing a reply to thinkbois on LinkedIn that I don’t even follow. Stopped and asked myself “wtf am I doing with my life right now” and moved on to something else. Close call, be vigilant out there folks!

item.title: Patriot E60269EC
item.description: “Patriot”, a memoir by Alexei Navalny that was published by his wife after his death comes out today. I’m looking forward to reading it. Does anyone happen to know where I could buy the Russian language edition?

item.description:
Had BCD Tofu House for dinner last night in Koreatown. That is my happy place for sure. So delicious!

On the hunt for Xi’An Famous Foods for lunch and then going to Tai Er in Flushing for dinner. ü§§

#nyc #food

item.title: Love AD8142F4
item.description: Started watching love is blind, its cheesy but I love it. Feels like a missed opportunity to make the first part a podcast so that all of us can learn what everyone looks like together.

item.title: Existential 34b8c81c
item.description:
Had a nice boost of existential dread this morning by reading “A Time for Compassion” from Rene Coignard where he compares life on this planet to a hospice.

To me, birth seems like the final stage of a terminal illness, inevitably followed by death.

Deep.

https://renecoignard.com/a-time-for-compassion/

item.title: Signal F3a11fd8
item.description:
Redownloaded signal after listening to the CEO Meredith Whittaker on the Kara Swisher podcast. I don’t remember why I stopped using it, but excited to give it another go.

https://megaphone.link/VMP1340571392

item.title: St Frank C3a2c383
item.description:
A few weeks ago my favorite local Coffee Shop (St. Frank on Folsom) remembered my order when I walked in and I was on top of the world becuase its hard to become a “local” in downtown SF.

Today they gave me a free cappucino. Our relationship is escalating and I’m madly in love. ü•∞

item.title: Clutter
item.description:
The joy of clutter. A look into the other side of Japanese minimalism.

Tsuzuki dismissed the West‚Äôs obsession with Japanese minimalism as ‚Äòsome Japanophile‚Äôs dream‚Äô in the introduction to the English translation of Tokyo: A Certain Style (1999).

https://aeon.co/essays/the-life-changing-magic-of-japanese-clutter

item.title: Weird
item.description: Still seeing some weird stuff in my posse module but overall I am happy with progress. Possible I’ll never lose another toot!

item.title: Secondattempt
item.description:
I made a lot of progress tonight on my goals for using hugo + Dagger to POSSE my way to success. Using a jenky technique that compares the existing to generated xml feed as a lazy database. If the system works you will see this post somewhere outside of my site.

https://levlaz.org/joining-the-posse-club/

item.title: Posse
item.description: This is my first post made with the posse system!
